text.0: mans worship of the gods hath three great lustres and three celestial lights have they established.
text.1: the maruts gifted with pure strength adore thee for thou o indra art their sapient Ṛṣi.
text.2: what time the maruts sang their song to indra joyous when he had drunk of soma juices.
text.3: he grasped his thunderbolt to slay the dragon and loosed that they might flow the youthful waters.
text.4: and o ye brahmans maruts so may indra drink draughts of this my carefully pressed soma.
text.5: for this oblation found for man the cattle and indra having quaffed it slew the dragon.
text.6: then heaven and earth he sundered and supported wrapped even in these he struck the beast with terror.
text.7: so indra forced the engulfer to disgorgement and slew the dānava panting against him.
text.8: thus all the gods o maghavan delivered to thee of their free will the draught of soma.
text.9: when thou for etaśa didst cause to tarry the flying mares of sūrya racing forward.
text.10: when maghavan with the thunderbolt demolished his nineandninety castles all together.
text.11: the maruts where they met glorified indra ye with the tṛṣṭup hymn obstructed heaven.
text.12: as friend to aid a friend agni dressed quickly three hundred buffaloes even as he willed it.
text.13: and indra from mans gift for vṛtras slaughter drank ofr at once three lakes of pressedout soma.
text.14: when thou three hundred buffaloes flesh hadst eaten and drunk as maghavan three lakes of soma.
text.15: all the gods raised as twere a shout of triumph to indra praise because he slew the dragon.
text.16: what time ye came with strong steeds swiftly speeding o uśanā and indra to the dwelling.
text.17: thou camest thither conquering together with kutsa and the gods thou slewest Śuṣṇa.
text.18: one carwheel of the sun thou rolledst forward and one thou settest free to move for kutsa.
text.19: thou slewest noseless dasyus with thy weapon and in their home oerthrewest hostile speakers.
text.20: the lauds of gauriviti made thee mighty to vidathins son as prey thou gavest pipru.
text.21: rjisivan drew thee into friendship dressing the sacred food and thou hast drunk his soma.
text.22: navagvas and dasgvas with libations of soma juice sing hymns of praise to indra.
text.23: labouring at their task the men laid open the stall of kine though firmly closed and fastened.
text.24: how shall i serve thee maghavan though knowing full well what hero deeds thou hast accomplished.
text.25: and the fresh deeds which thou wilt do most mighty these too will we tell forth in sacred synods.
text.26: resistless from of old through hero courage thou hast done all these many acts o indra.
text.27: what thou wilt do in bravery thunderwielder none is there who may hinder this thy prowess.
text.28: indra accept the prayers which now are offered accept the new prayers mightiest which we utter.
text.29: like fair and wellmade robes i seeking riches as a deft craftsman makes a car have wrought them.
